Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Obama said there will NOT be a National Day of Prayer in May, when in fact there is a scheduled National Day of Prayer on May 5th.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is a scheduled National Day of Prayer in May.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on false information and misinformation being spread on Facebook.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that President Obama doesn't want to offend anyone and is intentionally canceling the National Day of Prayer to appease Muslims.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for President Obama's actions, such as his previous involvement in other prayer events and his official proclamations for the National Day of Prayer in previous years.
Falters at times: The claim falters by spreading false information and perpetuating a debunked myth about President Obama canceling the National Day of Prayer.
